front.title: Quic Timestamps For Measuring One-Way Delays

abstract.t: The TIME_STAMP frame can be added to Quic packets when one way delay measurements is useful. The timestamp is set to the number of microseconds from the beginning of the connection to the time at which the packet is sent. The draft defines the "enable_time_stamp" transport parameter for negotiating the use of this extension frame, and a new frame types for the time_stamped frame.
